The Engineering Cycle at ECE Paris is a 5‑year program split into a 2‑year preparatory cycle and a 3‑year engineering cycle. You can choose majors like AI, Cybersecurity, Data, Embedded Systems, Networks, and more.
ECE Paris offers a full Engineering Cycle with strong industry connections and modern labs. You can specialize in areas like AI, Cyber, Data, IoT, and software engineering.
The Engineering Cycle is one of ECE’s flagship programs, combining technical courses, projects, internships, and international mobility.
The Preparatory Cycle (Prépa intégrée) covers the first two years of the Engineering Cycle. You’ll learn math, physics, programming, and engineering fundamentals.
ECE’s Prépa intégrée prepares you for the engineering cycle with strong foundations in science and digital technologies.
The preparatory cycle includes projects, labs, and personalized academic support to help you succeed in the engineering cycle.
ECE Paris offers Bachelor programs in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, and Data & AI. These are 3‑year programs focused on practical skills and industry readiness.
Bachelor programs at ECE are hands‑on and career‑oriented, with opportunities for internships and international mobility.
You can choose Bachelor tracks like Cybersecurity, Data & AI, or Computer Science depending on your interests.
ECE Paris offers MSc programs in Data Science, Cybersecurity, Cloud Computing, AI & Robotics, and IoT & Smart Systems. These programs are taught in English and open to international students.
MSc programs at ECE are designed for specialization and career acceleration, with strong industry partnerships.
If you're looking for advanced studies, ECE’s MSc programs offer modern labs, expert faculty, and project‑based learning.
ECE Paris has strong international mobility options, including Erasmus+, exchange programs, dual degrees, and English‑taught tracks.
You can study abroad for a semester or a full year through ECE’s international partnerships.
ECE welcomes international students and offers dedicated support for visas, housing, and integration.
ECE Paris offers alternance (work‑study) options in the Engineering Cycle, Bachelor programs, and some MSc programs. It’s a great way to gain experience while studying.
Alternance lets you split your time between classes and working in a company. Many students get job offers afterward.
ECE’s alternance programs are popular because they combine academic learning with real industry experience.
Admissions at ECE Paris depend on the program. You can apply online through the official website. Engineering Cycle, Bachelor, MSc, and international programs each have their own requirements.
To apply, you’ll need academic transcripts, ID documents, and sometimes an interview depending on the program.
ECE Paris accepts applications from both French and international students. The admissions team is super friendly if you need help.

Tuition fees vary by program. Engineering Cycle is usually around €9,000–€11,000 per year. Bachelor programs are around €7,000–€9,000. MSc programs range from €10,000–€13,000 depending on the specialization.
Alternance students often have reduced fees because companies cover part of the cost.
Fees can vary each year, so it’s always good to check the official website for the latest updates.
ECE Paris offers several financial aid options, including merit‑based scholarships and government support for eligible students.
International students can also apply for certain scholarships depending on their profile.
If you need help with fees, the admissions team can guide you through available scholarship options.
ECE Paris doesn’t have on‑campus housing, but there are many student residences near both the Paris and Lyon campuses.
You can find housing through CROUS, private residences, or shared apartments. The international office can help you get started.
Most students live in nearby neighborhoods with easy transport access.
The Paris campus is well connected by metro, tram, and bus. The Lyon campus also has excellent public transport access.
Most students use public transport, bikes, or shared mobility services to reach campus.
Both campuses are located in central, easy‑to‑reach areas.
ECE Paris has a modern library with study spaces, digital resources, and access to academic journals.
You can use the digital library for research, e‑books, and online databases.
The library is a great place to study quietly or work on group projects.
ECE Paris has specialized labs for AI, Cybersecurity, IoT, Robotics, Embedded Systems, and more.
Students get hands‑on experience in modern labs equipped with industry‑grade tools.
If you love practical learning, you’ll enjoy the lab‑based projects at ECE.
The IT support team can help with Wi‑Fi, accounts, software access, and technical issues.
If you have trouble logging in or connecting, the IT desk is super responsive.
You can contact IT support through the student portal.
Both campuses have cafeterias and plenty of food options nearby — from quick snacks to full meals.
Students often hang out in cafés around the campus for lunch or coffee breaks.
You’ll find vegetarian and international food options around the area.
ECE Paris has tons of student clubs — robotics, gaming, entrepreneurship, arts, sports, and more.
Joining a club is a great way to make friends and build skills outside class.
There’s something for everyone — tech, culture, sports, and creative clubs.
ECE students can join sports teams and access fitness facilities through partner organizations.
Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, and fitness training.
Sports events and tournaments happen throughout the year.
ECE Paris hosts events like hackathons, workshops, cultural festivals, and student parties.
There’s always something happening — tech events, club activities, and networking sessions.
You can check the student portal or club pages for upcoming events.
ECE Paris has strong industry connections, and students complete internships during their studies.
The career services team helps with CVs, interviews, and finding internship opportunities.
Many students find internships in tech companies, startups, and engineering firms.
ECE Paris has excellent placement outcomes, especially in tech fields like AI, Cybersecurity, Data, and Software Engineering.
Graduates work at companies like Capgemini, Thales, Orange, Airbus, Atos, and many startups.
The career services team organizes job fairs, networking events, and company meetups.
Exams follow the academic calendar and include continuous assessments, midterms, and finals.
You can find exam schedules on the student portal.
Each program has its own exam structure, but everything is clearly explained in the course guide.
You can check your results on the student portal once they’re published.
Grades are usually released a few weeks after exams.
If you have questions about grades, your academic advisor can help.
The academic calendar includes semester dates, holidays, and exam periods. You can find it on the official website.
Each program follows a structured academic calendar with clear timelines.
If you need specific dates, the student portal has the latest version.
ECE Paris has two campuses — one in Paris and one in Lyon. Both are located in central, accessible areas.
The Paris campus is in the 15th arrondissement, and the Lyon campus is in the Confluence district.
Both campuses offer modern facilities, labs, and student spaces.
You can contact ECE Paris through the official website’s contact page. They’ll direct you to the right department.
For program‑specific questions, the admissions team is super helpful.
If you need help as a student, the student services office is your go‑to place.
